comments:
Define the following three classes each in a separate file:

public class ATest<T> {}

public class BTest extends ATest<CTest> {}

public class CTest extends BTest {}

They compile without warnings or errors.
When you select the "ATest" in "BTest extends ATest<CTest>" and perform the
action "Open Declaration" from the context menu or by pressing F3, a NPE is thrown:

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.lookup.ClassScope.checkForInheritedMemberTypes(ClassScope.java:667)


The NPE does not occur if CTest doesn't extend BTest!

> Could not reproduce with latest. Could you please provide the build id?

It's the latest 3.2M2 stable build: I20050923-1000

In 3.2 stream, plugin version IDs have not yet been incremented, thus the 3.1.0
version. This will be fixed before 3.2 ships.

The stable version you tried is about a month old, and since then we released
numerous bug fixes.
